actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

official_title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for the payment of service pensions to veterans to World War I and the surviving spouses and children of such veterans.
short_title: World War I Veterans' Pension Act of 1989

summary.text: World War I Veterans' Pension Act of 1989 - Amends Federal veterans' benefits provisions to direct the Administrator (effective March 1989, Secretary) of Veterans Affairs to pay to each eligible World War I veteran a pension, in addition to any other pensions under current law, at the monthly rate of $150. Outlines eligibility requirements. Directs the Administrator to pay such pension to the surviving spouse of an eligible World War I veteran, or (if there is no surviving spouse) to the child or children of an eligible World War I veteran, at the same monthly rate.

titles.title: World War I Veterans' Pension Act of 1989
To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for the payment of service pensions to veterans to World War I and the surviving spouses and children of such veterans.
